snippet: A man who was trapped for hours with the gunman at the Pulse nightclub described a life-or-death game of deception. Another survivor recalled the killer’s “evil laugh.”
abstract: Survivors of Orlando, Fla, shooting massacre describe frightened and chaotic scene as Omar Mateen opened fire inside Pulse nightclub; several heard Mateen call 911 and calmly pledge his allegiance to Islamic State; first bursts of gunfire came around 2 am and did not end until about 5 am, when police officers blew hole in wall, enabling some hostages to escape, and engaged in fatal final confrontation with Mateen.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Jack Healy reported from Orlando, and Marc Santora from New York. John Eligon and Deborah Acosta contributed reporting from Orlando. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A man who was trapped for hours with the gunman at the Pulse nightclub described a life-or-death game of deception. Another survivor recalled the killer’s “evil laugh.”

headline.main: Held Hostage in an Orlando Restroom, and Playing Dead to Stay Alive
